intro: Ranunculus oculatidens, commonly known as the eye-leaf buttercup, is a striking perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It features palmately compound leaves with a distinctive central leaflet that resembles an eye, giving it its common name. The plant produces showy, yellow flowers with five broadly ovate petals and a prominent central stigma. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in meadows and rocky slopes. Its botanical characteristics make it a notable species in the Ranunculaceae family.
